snippet.title: Baggage handler hilariously fails at his one job
snippet.content:
Social media users expose bad baggage handling at airports 1:09
Angry passengers have taken to social media to expose the shocking treatment of their baggage, and not even celebrities are spared
July 31st 2017 4 hours ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Lifestyle - syndicated/
Baggage handler fails at his one job. Image: Reddit
Share
THIS will make you think twice about packing any precious possessions the next time you fly. When you wave goodbye to your luggage at check-in, you'd want to assume that the airline is going to treat your luggage with at least some sort of basic respect, right? Maybe not. A clip captured by a United Airlines passenger, and posted to Reddit, sums up perfectly just what it has been like to fly in 2017 - and you can't help but laugh a little.
Come on, it doesn't look like they're even trying.
